ygData.subject: Re: wizard spells
ygData.msgSnippet: No...i really meant TOMB  i m a rather strong wizard...just showing off my skills ;) Seriously, the tome is a recipe book for spells.  And yes, I need some
ygData.messageBody:
No...i really meant "TOMB" i'm a rather strong wizard...just showing off my
skills ;)

Seriously, the tome is a recipe book for spells. And yes, I need some work
on my Old Euridan (it's FEEBLE). I need to get someone with an AVERAGE or
ABOVE AVERAGE skill to teach (SPAM the hell out of the language in /say to
me) so I can learn this without wasting my training points.

- Ziff

-----Original Message-----
From: Ken Lee [mailto:kenlee@...]
Sent: Thursday, April 29, 1999 3:49 PM
To: eq_wizards@onelist.com
Subject: [eq_wizards] Re: wizard spells


From: "Ken Lee" <kenlee@...>

Isn't it a bit heavy walking around with a huge slab of granite : P

What I think those things you're talking about in the TOME is for actually
creating the scrolls. At least, that's what it would mean to me. Time to
work on those language skills, eh?

Zalbar
15th Wizard
Solusek Ro

-----Original Message-----
From: Spehar, David J <David.Spehar@...>
To: 'eq_wizards@onelist.com' <eq_wizards@onelist.com>
Date: 29 avril, 1999 15:46
Subject: [eq_wizards] Re: wizard spells


>From: "Spehar, David J" <David.Spehar@...>
>
>I have a Tomb that I can barely read right now but it speaks of being able
>to create "Invisibility, Shadow Step, Bandages...and numerous others. Most
>of the spells I can eventually create from this Tome's knowledge are going
>to rank 1-3 spells. This means I can sell them to younger mages at a
>reduced price from the merchants.
>
>- Ziffnab
>17th Wizard of Xegony
>
